description:
The Bibliographic Ontology Specification provides main concepts and properties for describing citations and bibliographic references (i.e. quotes, books, articles, etc) on the Semantic Web.

Used to describe authors, papers and publication information.

- Homepage: <http://bibliontology.com/>
- Namespace: `http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/` (alias `bibo`)

AcademicArticle.label: Academic Article
AcademicArticle.description: A scholarly academic article, typically published in a journal.

Article.label: Article
Article.description: A written composition in prose, usually nonfiction, on a specific topic, forming an independent part of a book or other publication, as a newspaper or magazine.

AudioVisualDocument.label: audio-visual document
AudioVisualDocument.description: An audio-visual document; film, video, and so forth.

Bill.label: Bill
Bill.description: Draft legislation presented for discussion to a legal body.

Book.label: Book
Book.description: A written or printed work of fiction or nonfiction, usually on sheets of paper fastened or bound together within covers.

Brief.label: Brief
Brief.description: A written argument submitted to a court.

CollectedDocument.label: Collected Document
CollectedDocument.description: A document that simultaneously contains other documents.

Collection.label: Collection
Collection.description: A collection of Documents or Collections

Conference.label: Conference
Conference.description: A meeting for consultation or discussion.

Document.label: Document
Document.description: A document (noun) is a bounded physical representation of body of information designed with the capacity (and usually intent) to communicate. A document may manifest symbolic, diagrammatic or sensory-representational information.

DocumentPart.label: document part
DocumentPart.description: a distinct part of a larger document or collected document.

DocumentStatus.label: Document Status
DocumentStatus.description: The status of the publication of a document.

Email.label: EMail
Email.description: A written communication addressed to a person or organization and transmitted electronically.

Excerpt.label: Excerpt
Excerpt.description: A passage selected from a larger work.

Hearing.label: Hearing
Hearing.description: An instance or a session in which testimony and arguments are presented, esp. before an official, as a judge in a lawsuit.

Image.label: Image
Image.description: A document that presents visual or diagrammatic information.

Interview.label: Interview
Interview.description: A formalized discussion between two or more people.

Issue.label: Issue
Issue.description: something that is printed or published and distributed, esp. a given number of a periodical

Journal.label: Journal
Journal.description: A periodical of scholarly journal Articles.

LegalCaseDocument.label: Legal Case Document
LegalCaseDocument.description: A document accompanying a legal case.

LegalDecision.label: Decision
LegalDecision.description: A document containing an authoritative determination (as a decree or judgment) made after consideration of facts or law.

LegalDocument.label: Legal Document
LegalDocument.description: A legal document; for example, a court decision, a brief, and so forth.

Legislation.label: Legislation
Legislation.description: A legal document proposing or enacting a law or a group of laws.

Letter.label: Letter
Letter.description: A written or printed communication addressed to a person or organization and usually transmitted by mail.

Magazine.label: Magazine
Magazine.description: A periodical of magazine Articles. A magazine is a publication that is issued periodically, usually bound in a paper cover, and typically contains essays, stories, poems, etc., by many writers, and often photographs and drawings, frequently specializing in a particular subject or area, as hobbies, news, or sports.

Manual.label: Manual
Manual.description: A small reference book, especially one giving instructions.

Manuscript.label: Manuscript
Manuscript.description: An unpublished Document, which may also be submitted to a publisher for publication.

Map.label: Map
Map.description: A graphical depiction of geographic features.

MultiVolumeBook.label: Multivolume Book
MultiVolumeBook.description: A loose, thematic, collection of Documents, often Books.

Newspaper.label: Newspaper
Newspaper.description: A periodical of documents, usually issued daily or weekly, containing current news, editorials, feature articles, and usually advertising.

Note.label: Note
Note.description: Notes or annotations about a resource.

Patent.label: Patent
Patent.description: A document describing the exclusive right granted by a government to an inventor to manufacture, use, or sell an invention for a certain number of years.

Periodical.label: Periodical
Periodical.description: A group of related documents issued at regular intervals.

PersonalCommunication.label: Personal Communication
PersonalCommunication.description: A communication between an agent and one or more specific recipients.

PersonalCommunicationDocument.label: Personal Communication Document
PersonalCommunicationDocument.description: A personal communication manifested in some document.

Proceedings.label: Proceedings
Proceedings.description: A compilation of documents published from an event, such as a conference.

ReferenceSource.label: Reference Source
ReferenceSource.description: A document that presents authoritative reference information, such as a dictionary or encylopedia .

Report.label: Report
Report.description: A document describing an account or statement describing in detail an event, situation, or the like, usually as the result of observation, inquiry, etc..

Series.label: Series
Series.description: A loose, thematic, collection of Documents, often Books.

Slideshow.label: Slideshow
Slideshow.description: A presentation of a series of slides, usually presented in front of an audience with written text and images.

Standard.label: Standard
Standard.description: A document describing a standard: a specification organized through a standards body.

Thesis.label: Thesis
Thesis.description: A document created to summarize research findings associated with the completion of an academic degree.

ThesisDegree.label: Thesis degree
ThesisDegree.description: The academic degree of a Thesis

Webpage.label: Webpage
Webpage.description: A web page is an online document available (at least initially) on the world wide web. A web page is written first and foremost to appear on the web, as distinct from other online resources such as books, manuscripts or audio documents which use the web primarily as a distribution mechanism alongside other more traditional methods such as print.

Website.label: Website
Website.description: A group of Webpages accessible on the Web.

Workshop.label: Workshop
Workshop.description: A seminar, discussion group, or the like, that emphasizes zxchange of ideas and the demonstration and application of techniques, skills, etc.

affirmedBy.description: A legal decision that affirms a ruling.

annotates.label: annotates
annotates.description: Critical or explanatory note for a Document.

argued.label: date argued
argued.description: The date on which a legal case is argued before a court. Date is of format xsd:date

authorList.label: list of authors
authorList.description: An ordered list of authors. Normally, this list is seen as a priority list that order authors by importance.

citedBy.label: cited by
citedBy.description: Relates a document to another document that cites thefirst document.

cites.label: cites
cites.description: Relates a document to another document that is citedby the first document as reference, comment, review, quotation or foranother purpose.

content.label: content
content.description: This property is for a plain-text rendering of the content of a Document. While the plain-text content of an entire document could be described by this property.

contributorList.label: list of contributors
contributorList.description: An ordered list of contributors. Normally, this list is seen as a priority list that order contributors by importance.

court.label: court
court.description: A court associated with a legal document; for example, that which issues a decision.

distributor.label: distributor
distributor.description: Distributor of a document or a collection of documents.

edition.label: edition
edition.description: The name defining a special edition of a document. Normally its a literal value composed of a version number and words.

editor.label: editor
editor.description: A person having managerial and sometimes policy-making responsibility for the editorial part of a publishing firm or of a newspaper, magazine, or other publication.

editorList.label: list of editors
editorList.description: An ordered list of editors. Normally, this list is seen as a priority list that order editors by importance.

interviewee.label: interviewee
interviewee.description: An agent that is interviewed by another agent.

interviewer.label: interviewer
interviewer.description: An agent that interview another agent.

issuer.label: issuer
issuer.description: An entity responsible for issuing often informally published documents such as press releases, reports, etc.

locator.label: locator
locator.description: A description (often numeric) that locates an item within a containing document or collection.

numPages.label: number of pages
numPages.description: The number of pages contained in a document

numVolumes.label: number of volumes
numVolumes.description: The number of volumes contained in a collection of documents (usually a series, periodical, etc.).

number.label: number
number.description: A generic item or document number. Not to be confused with issue number.

organizer.label: organizer
organizer.description: The organizer of an event; includes conference organizers, but also government agencies or other bodies that are responsible for conducting hearings.

owner.label: owner
owner.description: Owner of a document or a collection of documents.

pageEnd.label: page end
pageEnd.description: Ending page number within a continuous page range.

pageStart.label: page start
pageStart.description: Starting page number within a continuous page range.

pages.label: pages
pages.description: A string of non-contiguous page spans that locate a Document within a Collection. Example: 23-25, 34, 54-56. For continuous page ranges, use the pageStart and pageEnd properties.

presentedAt.label: presented at
presentedAt.description: Relates a document to an event; for example, a paper to a conference.

presents.label: presents
presents.description: Relates an event to associated documents; for example, conference to a paper.

producer.label: producer
producer.description: Producer of a document or a collection of documents.

recipient.label: recipient
recipient.description: An agent that receives a communication document.

reproducedIn.description: The resource in which another resource is reproduced.

reversedBy.description: A legal decision that reverses a ruling.

reviewOf.label: review of
reviewOf.description: Relates a review document to a reviewed thing (resource, item, etc.).

status.label: status
status.description: The publication status of (typically academic) content.

status/accepted.label: accepted
status/accepted.description: Accepted for publication after peer reviewing.

status/nonPeerReviewed.label: non peer reviewed
status/nonPeerReviewed.description: A document that is not peer reviewed

status/peerReviewed.label: peer reviewed
status/peerReviewed.description: The process by which articles are chosen to be included in a refereed journal. An editorial board consisting of experts in the same field as the author review the article and decide if it is authoritative enough for publication.

status/rejected.label: rejected
status/rejected.description: Rejected for publication after peer reviewing.

subsequentLegalDecision.description: A legal decision on appeal that takes action on a case (affirming it, reversing it, etc.).

transcriptOf.label: transcript of
transcriptOf.description: Relates a document to some transcribed original.

translationOf.label: translation of
translationOf.description: Relates a translated document to the original document.

translator.label: translator
translator.description: A person who translates written document from one language to another.

uri.label: uri
uri.description: Universal Resource Identifier of a document
